												This is a game where you play as a psychic-cyborg-warrior-monk thing of a man wielding a katana that's not only powered by some eldritch thing that keeps blinking at you, but can also slice your enemies in half AND block freaking lasers! You can hack people so that their brains explode!You can clone yourself and unleash a small squad of yourself on your enemies!You can run as fast as a Olympic-sprinter and jump twice your own height! This is a decent description of your character at the start of the tutorial.AFTER THAT YOUR POWER GROWS!!!In the name of honesty, there is some bugs and (unintended) weirdness, but if the above sentences didn't grab you then nothing will. Imagine Deus Ex if it had been made by french people on peyote, while they played WAY too much Warhammer 40K and re watched Blade runner and Ghost in the shell for the hundredth time and you won't be far off!  You'll either love it or hate it, but try the demo at least, if nothing else it's unique.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 21, 2014
												Firstly, the concept is amazing. Kind of like a cross between Warhammer 40K (as has been said before), Blade Runner, Dune, Total Recall, Equilibrium, and probably a few other classics I can't think of right now, with a lot of original - and borrowed, stuff on the surface and underneath, including paranormal phenomena, cyberpunk and genetic body mods, hacking, genetic manipulation for basic skill boosts/affinities, and futuristic Rastafarianism. The quintessential Sci-Fi nerd's game, IMO.There's a money system for investing in physical/cybernetic enhancements and weapons, and research toward the same, all funded by things like bounties, hacking bank computers, and lump-sum mission completion rewards. There's also a skill point-based leveling system with lots of options for specialization, e.g., stealth, brute force, finesse, faster/greater health/recovery, athletics/acrobatics, psychic control/telekinesis, hacking enemy machinery/weapons - even their  brains to do your bidding (but watch out, you may get hacked if they're better than you!), et al.Some say it tries to do too much. I like all of the things it does too much to agree. Granted, the dialogue seems to be poorly translated, but in a far-flung future, a significant change in vernacular isn't inconceivable. I think it adds depth, in that respect. Maybe it was deliberate. There's also a bit of a learning curve due to a clunky tutorial, but creating a couple of throw-away characters while practicing and figuring out what you like isn't at all uncommon.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 29, 2014
												Absolutely recommend picking this game up. It's a bit difficult to grasp, but once you get rolling, (and this is all assuming you're a cyberpunk fan) you won't be able to drop it. The eerie and gloomy atmosphere is sure to immerse you completely, the fun, innovative gameplay is bound to keep you constantly searching for new ways to overcome a problem, and if all else fails - the randomly generated missions will always be there for a quick jolt when you're in a race with time.The story is a marvel the likes of which I haven't seen yet. I read a lot of books, I watch a lot of movies, shows, but E.Y.E.'s incredibly complex, multi-dimensional, multi-layered allegorical presentation of consciousness was genuinely one of the greatest experiences of my life. As a matter of fact - I believe that the specific story (which I leave for you to figure out) is in its optimal medium; no book or song could ever transfer the atmosphere the same way this game does. The amount of thought I put into the thematic of the whole game, and the amount of time I spent trying to understand the underlying philosophical problems - both in the game, and transfered into real life - is unprecedented.As many agree, if you're one in favor of immersive, drawn-out, atmospheric surrounding, and if you're a fan of the strange, -AND- an enthusiastic problem-solver, this masterpiece will become one of your favorites, too. The game offers too much of the three for anyone to miss them during gameplay, and is sure to have something for everyone who doesn't play video games just for the pure time-wasting aspect of it, but for the artistic value.And before you decide to opt out, riddle me this - "Are you lost? Or have you been lost since the very beginning?"

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 8, 2014
												tl;dr: Good: The level design, the ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ story if you're the kind that likes to speculate, and weapons not saddled by the need to be "realistic" or even balancedBad: They're not the smartest cops or looters. LOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOONG loading times. The story if the storytelling style isn't something that you can't really appreciateWherever you go, whoever you side with, you will always Brouzouf. This insane first person shooter/RPG hybrid has one of the craziest stories ever written, where the story lapses in and out of coherence and continuity, yet still works very well. The enviroments are amazing and highly inspired, and massive. Quite a feat, especially with source engine. While there is one huge loading screen at the beginning of the huge levels, they are the only ones, there are no loading screens anywhere within a level, in the the massive ones like the Headquarters or Mars. Enemies look great, although their intellegence leaves a bit to be desired. One looter blew his buddy up after shooting him with his shotgun that he was aiming at me. Well, the first one shouldn't have stood in his way anyways. Enemy spawn can be a bit of a pain, too. New Eden has a spot next to some shipping containers that spawns Federal Police whenever you're not facing, even if you're facing away but standing next to the spawn point, they'll spawn. Then shoot you. Secreta help you if they have the dreaded Bear Killer. That would mean you have the demon gun too, though. You do have it, right? Brings up another point: the weapons. Dear God those weapons. A handgun that is an effective anti-air and anti-demon cannon. A minigun good against large groups of squishy Feds, Looters, and beasts, although not the best choice for armored enemies like Interceptors. A shotgun that goes further, so much further, than a sneeze. A katana that blows people up. Even the AK knockoff has an awesome feel for it. An SMG that has two firing modes: Full and Fuller. It all comes from the magical Armory of Holding in the beginning of each level that makes you feel like you're going through a candy store with a "all you can eat" coupon. Some minor complaints. Again the AI. You've probably already know my gripes so no further. Furthering the skill tree involves randomly dropping briefcases, in which those have randomly generated technology dropped, some of them being much rarer than others. You can find S.O.B 13 easy, though if you find Cybernecromancy, go ahead and buy a lottery ticket right after. It can be a pain to unlock weapons and technology because of this. If you play on the lower difficulties, it can also be difficult to gather enough brouzouf, cold hard cash, to fund research, cyberlimbs, PSI abilities, and most importantly: weapons. This is easily remedied by not being a wimp and cranking the difficulty up: Ghost usually has you swimming in cash, particuarly if you unlock the Bear Killer and go Dues Ex Machina and Interceptor hunting with it. The AI I can forgive because the rest of the game carries it, and also because this game gets cheaper than a meal at In-N-Out during sales. The rest of the issues can be remedied or at least fixed with a bandaid by adjusting spawn rates and AI behavior. Overall, I highly recommend this game. It looks a bit dated but the design is great, the guns feel deadly, and it doesn't feel the need to limit the player in case he gets "too strong".

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 14, 2014
												This game is a fantastic work of gameplay and storytelling. While the engine is old, the translation not-so-awesome, and the rate of research drops absolutely silly, the rest of the game is well worth $10 any day. Zipping around the battlefield with fully upgraded cyberlegs and bashing in heads with hammers and swords has never been so much fun. Be sure to play it again for each of 4 different endings and spend hours with others just trying to understand the full plot. Good gunplay and fun map design round out the experience, all of which is much more fun with more people. Hop onto a server hosting anywhere from 2 to 32 players for a crazy time of monster slaying, federation beating, and brouzouf gathering.At $1, this game is a steal. Grab it and play it. You won't regret it.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 16, 2012
												E.Y.E is far from perfect. It's weird, obtuse to the point of being frustrating and the dialogue often feels like it's been run through Google translate (Streum On are French, so it probably has). The weirdness is actually one of the things I like about it though. The grammatically flawed text not so much; Streum could definitely benefit from a native English speaker going through all the dialogue and making it less obviously written by someone who isn't.But the weirdness works. E.Y.E comes across like a blend between 40K's Inquisition and one of the evil megacorps of Syndicate; with it's bizarre mix of psionic techno-magery, cyberpunk gadgetry and John Blanche-esque armour suits. It gets compared a lot to a 'fever dream'; and given the developer's stated enjoyment of H.P Lovecraft, this is not a bad comparison. E.Y.E's very openended and that can work against it for some - too much choice, especially with little guidance as to how those choices will affect you in the field, can be off-putting. You do have to read around the little windows and you sometimes have to live with a choice that might not have been exactly what you were expecting. Enemy levels can be a tad overwhelming, too. Freely re-spawning legions of mooks are a pain in the♥♥♥♥♥when combined with big, dark, labyrinths and vague mission briefs and this can make the side-quests (which are pretty basic; essentially retreads of levels you've completed with different random objectives like Kill X, Fetch Y), feel a touch grindy as you mow down two gangs of mooks only to be set on by two more as you reload and scavenge bullets from the corpses. Steam's recommendation windows are really too small - so, yeah. E.Y.E's interface and tutorials are almost ferociously unfriendly to those of us who've grown accustomed to the hand-holding of more recent RPG / FPS releases. E.Y.E leans more to the school of "Here, work it out for yourself." Which has been one of the big bones of contention about it for many. Purely for clarity; I mean good, old Syndicate, not the shoddy modern FPS with the brand name tacked on. But it still feels fun; the guns work well and slicing and dicing the enemy with your psionic katana and blue-glowy psi-fist is still satisfying (see also the teleporting into other people to make them explode method). Although it's billed as an FPS/RPG, the RPG side of things is mainly a case of what numbers you put up on your character sheet, although there are plot twisty things down the line.Me, I like it. As has been observed, what other game lets you cloak and teleport yourself into the body of an enemy so that they explode?Also, it's cheap. And has trading cards :gordon: Give it a whirl.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 21, 2014
												Firstly, the concept is amazing. Kind of like a cross between Warhammer 40K (as has been said before), Blade Runner, Dune, Total Recall, Equilibrium, and probably a few other classics I can't think of right now, with a lot of original - and borrowed, stuff on the surface and underneath, including paranormal phenomena, cyberpunk and genetic body mods, hacking, genetic manipulation for basic skill boosts/affinities, and futuristic Rastafarianism. The quintessential Sci-Fi nerd's game, IMO.There's a money system for investing in physical/cybernetic enhancements and weapons, and research toward the same, all funded by things like bounties, hacking bank computers, and lump-sum mission completion rewards. There's also a skill point-based leveling system with lots of options for specialization, e.g., stealth, brute force, finesse, faster/greater health/recovery, athletics/acrobatics, psychic control/telekinesis, hacking enemy machinery/weapons - even their  brains to do your bidding (but watch out, you may get hacked if they're better than you!), et al.Some say it tries to do too much. I like all of the things it does too much to agree. Granted, the dialogue seems to be poorly translated, but in a far-flung future, a significant change in vernacular isn't inconceivable. I think it adds depth, in that respect. Maybe it was deliberate. There's also a bit of a learning curve due to a clunky tutorial, but creating a couple of throw-away characters while practicing and figuring out what you like isn't at all uncommon.

												My hacking attempt had failed and so Rimanah stood there with the Black Crow to my head.  As I waited for him to pull the trigger I realised that he wasn't going to.  He wasn't going to because he was waiting for me.  Why?  Because he wasn't there to begin with.  I was holding the Black Crow.  I and I alone.  I lower the gun from my temple and slowly stand.  The wind blows with force now, carrying the stench of half remembered crimes.  I put the Black Crow away and see that my legs are Ok.  So I draw the Damocles and, with a force that sunders the ground beneath my feet, hurl myself a titan's span into the grinning face of the Deuse Ex.  Why?  Because my hacking attempt had failed.  My hacking attempt failed because you can't hack a dream.

content:
Posted: January 11, 2014
												I bought it a couple of years ago, played for a few minutes, then gave up... I reinstalled it today because I couldn't remember why did I give up playing it before. Now I remember why: the terribly complicated interface and its tiny writings. If you want to understand what's what, what's not and what's going on, you'll have to do a lot of reading, and I have to say, reading those tiny little letters in a greenish/grayish kind of environment involves a lot of eye strain... Now I realize that the name of the game must be a hint as to what you'll be in for, should you decide to play it. Now the gameplay and combat are alright, if you can look past the dated graphics. Overall, its an OK shooter with some RPG elements, unfortnatelly I cannot tell you more because as I said, the interface drives me crazy and I cannot get myself to like the whole thing because of that. For the price it normally sells (on sale today for 1,99), I'd recommend anyone to give it a try, maybe you won't find the same issues I did, and you'll get to have a nice experience. Good luck.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 8, 2014
												tl;dr: Good: The level design, the ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ story if you're the kind that likes to speculate, and weapons not saddled by the need to be "realistic" or even balancedBad: They're not the smartest cops or looters. LOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOONG loading times. The story if the storytelling style isn't something that you can't really appreciateWherever you go, whoever you side with, you will always Brouzouf. This insane first person shooter/RPG hybrid has one of the craziest stories ever written, where the story lapses in and out of coherence and continuity, yet still works very well. The enviroments are amazing and highly inspired, and massive. Quite a feat, especially with source engine. While there is one huge loading screen at the beginning of the huge levels, they are the only ones, there are no loading screens anywhere within a level, in the the massive ones like the Headquarters or Mars. Enemies look great, although their intellegence leaves a bit to be desired. One looter blew his buddy up after shooting him with his shotgun that he was aiming at me. Well, the first one shouldn't have stood in his way anyways. Enemy spawn can be a bit of a pain, too. New Eden has a spot next to some shipping containers that spawns Federal Police whenever you're not facing, even if you're facing away but standing next to the spawn point, they'll spawn. Then shoot you. Secreta help you if they have the dreaded Bear Killer. That would mean you have the demon gun too, though. You do have it, right? Brings up another point: the weapons. Dear God those weapons. A handgun that is an effective anti-air and anti-demon cannon. A minigun good against large groups of squishy Feds, Looters, and beasts, although not the best choice for armored enemies like Interceptors. A shotgun that goes further, so much further, than a sneeze. A katana that blows people up. Even the AK knockoff has an awesome feel for it. An SMG that has two firing modes: Full and Fuller. It all comes from the magical Armory of Holding in the beginning of each level that makes you feel like you're going through a candy store with a "all you can eat" coupon. Some minor complaints. Again the AI. You've probably already know my gripes so no further. Furthering the skill tree involves randomly dropping briefcases, in which those have randomly generated technology dropped, some of them being much rarer than others. You can find S.O.B 13 easy, though if you find Cybernecromancy, go ahead and buy a lottery ticket right after. It can be a pain to unlock weapons and technology because of this. If you play on the lower difficulties, it can also be difficult to gather enough brouzouf, cold hard cash, to fund research, cyberlimbs, PSI abilities, and most importantly: weapons. This is easily remedied by not being a wimp and cranking the difficulty up: Ghost usually has you swimming in cash, particuarly if you unlock the Bear Killer and go Dues Ex Machina and Interceptor hunting with it. The AI I can forgive because the rest of the game carries it, and also because this game gets cheaper than a meal at In-N-Out during sales. The rest of the issues can be remedied or at least fixed with a bandaid by adjusting spawn rates and AI behavior. Overall, I highly recommend this game. It looks a bit dated but the design is great, the guns feel deadly, and it doesn't feel the need to limit the player in case he gets "too strong".

												This game may be seen as a mess at first, and honestly it is, but there's something very special about that seperates it from other FPS games of today. This game has so many choices and so many options that it actually seems too complex for the player at first (if buying this game, I'd recommend watching How To's first as the game does not explain each of the features). Don't despair, and press on as this game has wonderful immersion and you will be able to catch on quickly. I almost immediately got addicted and played nearly 9 hours straight. I highly recommend this game to anyone who loves Deus Ex

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 17, 2012
												E.Y.E has the strange distinction of being an FPSRPG that does not sacrifice FPS for RPG or vice versa - the gunplay is solid, but the RPG gameplay is also on par with it. The setting is also very unique with its "neo-midieval cyberpunk" aesthetic. However, the story is confusing and there are plenty of rough edges. Something to be careful of is that this game is very much a 90's game - it will not hold your hand, almost ever. Though at the same time, this game provides a rock-solid gameplay core and unparalleled custom mechanics. You can even tweak spawning rates, mob difficulty, and AI settings in the options.To wrap up, get this game if you want to experience a very left-field, experimental take on FPSRPG core gameplay. I highly recommend you read wikis and other resources as you play, as they make discovering this game more enjoyable than going blind. Personally, I love this game just because it's not afraid of what it is - an extremely ambitious game with rough edges.

Very indepth RPG elements, fun fire fights with enemies, and overall just a surprisingly pleasing title.If you're a cyberpunk fan, you shouldn't pass this up.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 10, 2015
												This game is... really odd. It's an FPS RPG on the source engine with some strange mechanics that make gameplay difficult and confusing. It's also one of my favorite games of all time.Aside from the run of the mill gunplay (which is really solid and satisfying for the most part), theres a whole world of complicated menu-based spells, some of which (mainly hacking anything, like ANYTHING in the game to aid you) begins an RTS-like miniagme in which you manage a variety of stats to out-hack your opponent.The game is not friendly to newcomers in both it's gameplay and lore, but an intriguing story, cool visual style, and gameplay thats fun wether you know whats going on or not, make it something definatey worth playing.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 8, 2014
												Deus Ex with JC Denton and the world overdosing on steroids.Warhammer 40k: A Day in the Life of a Psyker.Serious Sam: Beyond Serious.Maps are huge. Backtracking is very common.You choose your loadout. No prebuilt ones, you choose your armor, weapons and ammunition yourself.Hack everything. People, terminals, turrets, etc. Take command, convert them to your side, drain their energy or explode them. Yourchoice.No save slots. The game instead saves after you progress along the campaign, like checkpoints.This game is crazy in both plot and game mechanics. Get used to the game mechanics and you can little by little begin to understand the plot little by little.Worth the buy. Also worth the confusion.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 1, 2016
												The whole game feels so alien, so strange, but there are just enough common threads along this winding, confusing, rambling journey that make the whole game feel not just unique, but damn good. Like a recurring dream that, despite not making any sense, is pleasant and always feels like it's going somewhere, but then, you always wake up, wondering what will happen next. And you'll keep wondering as you play, and after the game's conclusion. But you'll have to work for that. This game is brutally dificult, and it's more difficult the more badass you want your character to be. This can be alleviated by inviting friends with their skill trees leveled in all the skills you've neglected, but regardless of the route you take, becoming a good, independent player will take a lot of time, and a lot of patience.The combat is... Well, what you'd expect from a Source game. Bullets hit their targets, melee is either useless or incredibly effective with no inbetweens, the ragdolls and gore are pretty nice, the textures are adequate and the sound design is good. The soundtrack is lovely and captures the dark, surreal cyberpunk atmosphere of this game perfectly.This is by no means a perfect game, but it is crafted in such a way that even its odd little quirks and subtle flaws do not detract from the experience, and in some cases, even add to its charm.No game like this has been made quite like this one before in terms of its overall presentation and atmosphere, and perhaps there will never be another game like this one, even if a sequel is made.But hey, that's just me- I understand that this is, at the end of the day, a strange product with a niche audience, and one could safely say that you could go your whole life without buying this and playing this, but I sincerely hope you do anyways.

content:
Posted: May 1, 2015
												a badly translated beautiful & brutally complicated fps honestly, i love the game, the story isnt so good, but thats not why you're playing Eyeyou're playing it to be simultaneously hopelessly confused and yet entranced by deep rpg mechanics that you can actually see take effect in an fps. the story reminds me a lot of neuromancer/fallout/syndicate, perhaps that is an ignorant observation within the cyberpunk context. but the game mechanics, the squad based attacks, fighting your characters hopelessness and broken legs. the leveling and sometimes unfair clicky hacking minigame, more than make up for any shortcomings to me.or maybe, just the fact that the mechanics are so richly done in a genre full of soggy one note AAA games.

Posted: September 23, 2014
												At first, you get a shotgun with 32 shells in its magazine that can make people explode from medium range. That's pretty great.Also, an SMG that can fire at something like 3000rpm.And a minigun.Then you notice you can make clones of yourself to shoot dudes. That's also pretty great, even if they die in one shot.Then you unlock the ability to telefrag enemies on command.Then you get a pistol that destroys helicopters in two shots.Then you get a hammer that destroys them in one hit.Then you get the ability to just throw a car at the helicopter to destroy it.All of this while sprinting at 50 miles per hour.In heavy armor.it's pretty neat

												This is so far the only game where i felt like a true top of the line cyborg warrior.And the multiplayer is the most weird fun i have ever had. number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 22, 2014
												Lets say, I love this game.Huge RPG elements (story, experience, leveling, store interface,) with good combat mechanics, and an interesting world. Simply put, the type of game I've been waiting for since I was 4.If this game had been made by a highly funded game studio, or with kickstarter-like backing, it would have been absolutely amazing. As is, the over-the-top awesome is shaded by some serious problems. A very steep learning curve, and a truely vile interface take some of the wind out of the game. Add in the occasional random deaths, and the occasional game-breaking bug, and it can be an exercise in rage management.That being said, if a dozen games came out just like this, with different stories and slightly varied mechanics, I would buy them all and play 100+ hours on each.Goods:Fluid combatWell designed/implemented RPG elementsExcellent world/universeBads:Awkward interfaceOccasional awkward bugsLimited tutorialConsistently mediocre translation/language use

Posted: November 3, 2014
												This game is a hard game to review. I love almost everything about this game from the surreal cyberpunk atmosphere to the sick sense of humor expressed through character actions and dialogue.Unfortunately, it isn't wrong to say this game is incomplete.It is complete as far as the developers are concerned, but it lacks a proper tutorial system, the game is generally riddled with bugs, the level design can be confusing and sometimes monotonous, and the story is utterly devoid of a conclusion. This game is not for the impatient. You really have to be willing to experiment and explore to thoroughly enjoy this game.All of that said, if you have the right mindset and a couple of good friends to play with this game can be a blast. The story is deep and is very good overall, but it can be confusing and difficult to follow. The upgrades and leveling system can be very rewarding and the powers and abilities are very useful in certain situations. And if you have enough friends this game supports 32 player coop, so thats pretty fun.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 9, 2014
												The game's pretty fun, there are lots of ways you can take out your enemy, by shooting, by hacking, by hitting with melee weapons, by blasting with psi powers, etc.Despite what people say, this game isn't stable... it's liable to crashes, sometimes the multiplayer bugs out, the ranking system sticks to the first rank you attain and doesn't upgrade further (besides the Eqillibrium ranks). Some of the achevements don't work. The stealth system isn't much good unless your have a cloak upgrade. Some of the enemies are overpowered. There are fatal wounds which forever affect your stats, which can be pretty annoying (especially for those who are focusing their skill points on single skills to earn ranks).Other than all that, it's a fun and challenging game. I highly recommend you play the demo first before buying the full game, just to see what it's like.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 31, 2015
												Messed up, confusional, mysterious, and a story hard to understand, but easy to match it up by yourself (if you're insane enough). That's why i love this game.E.Y.E: Divine Cybermancy is one of the best shooter RPG i have ever played, with a story set in a futuristic cyberpunk world and a plot full of mystery, with a gameplay that gives you great freedom of customization for your character with lots of ways to upgrade your character.Also being the game set in a distant future, there are surely some features in the game that fits this age, like the hacking system, since everything is computerized (even your mind), that will let you get into particular objectives, control your enemies, rob some money and more.Another feature of the game is the sanity meter, that is pretty much self-explanatory: you will lose sanity when you see too much strange or bad stuffs, or when your mental power is low, and when you lose too much of it, you'll start seeing and hearing random things.The game has almost infinite replayability, with  different kind of "endings"  and extra missions that you can do for the different map models, or obviously to gain more money and experience.The audio of most important dialogues is chinese, so better you put the subtitles on if you don't understand the language, to get something more about the game.For the multiplayer, there aren't much people playing into the servers, but you can surely grab some friends to play the campaign togheter (i had to use the Hamachi tool to make it run and modified some stuff in the console, since the game is powered by the Source engine).That is it. I loved the game once i understood how to play it and how to give a sense to the story, since  it's damn hard to give it a sense if you don't put together all the pieces of the puzzle, because this game is, infact, a puzzle game. EXTRA NOTE FOR WHO NEEDS: In the game's folder located into steam's one, you can find the soundtrack of the game: "Steam/SteamApps/common/EYE/EYE/sound/music". Here you'll find in order the tracks you'll hear during the game,  and the one named "qnJ"  is the most awesome one, that you'll hear for very little time during the game. You're welcome. EXTRA-EXTRA NOTE: Illuminati approves.

content:
Posted: December 30, 2014
												-Serious Review-I would like to say that before you say anything... i'm gonna review this game as a "coop experience" instead of a Singleplayer one... this game has been promoted to have a very good coop and that's why i got it ( if you will say that i have to play it SP... i think this is a "borderlands" type of game, where if you play it solo you'll get really REALLY bored).... But the coop experience to this day is♥♥♥♥♥♥ its unplayable... Not even with the fastest internet or fastest rig a good server can be hosted... if you're going to get it for the coop PLEASE BE AWARE THAT ITS NEARLY IMPOSSIBLE.Since i couldn't complete the game and i'm not interested in complete it i'll point out what it's worth of this game:+ The level design is amazing , the only con to this is that almost all of the levels are really confusive. although it's meant to be explored you can get lost REALLY easily+ Some designs although just mix cyberpunk with medieval are really good+ Plausible gunplay+ kind of plausible melee fight+ Interesting hacking minigame... Simplistic but fun, the only con is that if you don't do it very good or you're not in the mood for hacking it will get REALLY frustrating.+ 5/10 soundtrack... some are good ... others are REALLY innecesary.- The enemies in this game ( all of them) feel bland. really nothing to offer, even the cyberdemon monster type it's really uninteresting to fight ( it's so op too... well this reminds me of Doom some how lololol)- REALLY BAD VOICE ACTING ... even Far Cry voice acting is better (believe me)- lack of tutorial or explanations about the gameplay features ( all of them are in a list of minivideos... and even the minivideo list doesn't cover much of the core gameplay)- REALLY IMPOSSIBLE MULTIPLAYER I DON'T EVEN RECOMMEND ( YES THIS INCLUDE THE MOTHER♥♥♥♥ING COOP EXPLANATION I PUT).- Really bad story, narrative, Everything... THE GAME DOESNT EVEN MAKE SENSE... DONT EVEN TRY TO MAKE SENSE OUT OF IT AS OTHER REVIEWS SAYS.I was going to put a hand down... but in the end at least the concept idea of the game its interesting... this game is a game you have to make a run and forget about it... don't even try to get a replay out of it... play it solo , finish it... and boom. end it... you're not missing much.i'd get this game if it's 3-0.99 dollars... that's what is worth... don't waste more.if you want to waste your time exploring a bit or get away with a "different game type" ...  i recommend it.BUT if you want to play this game in coop, make metagame coop with your friends, do the coop missions and all of that stuff: DON'T.glhf.

content:
Posted: December 1, 2016
												This game require you to but 100% of your mental focus to it while playing or else you won't understand sh!t.The setting of E.Y.E. is...... Special, even though there's alot of games and movies that have a somewhat next to the same setting, E.Y.E. managed to deliver it in a rather strange unique way.......Gameplay is too much complicated but it's really fun once you get the hang of it.Story wise the game have massive plotholes that are only covered by reading tons of codex entries and history books and talking with different NPCs, It's really good once you get to understand what's going on (And you won't until you finish the game for the first time) but in my opinion if it was a bit more polished it would have been a AAA tragedic/Sci-fi story.all in all I would recommend E.Y.E. to anyone who's into deep sci-fi games and is ready to isolate from the outside and spend sometime reading, reading for a game that you will never forget.

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 6, 2014
												This might be the most bizarre FPS I ever played. So much, in fact, that reviewing it is a challenge itself. So here goes.It claims to be an FPS, and yet has a ton of RPG systems, including a DNA combiner with stat rolling. It has melee combat, which includes badass dual-wielding katanas (or dual-wield with guns!) and a ginormous hammer, and yet stealth doesn't work well, as they can spot you from literally a mile away (even when you can't see them yourself!) and you'll be easily overwhelmed by the insane spawn rate in certain areas of the game, with many of them having ranged enemies, and some with absurd amounts of health.There are amazing (and balanced!) PSI powers in this game, including certain ones that you earn thoughout the game, and can really help you out, and yet you use PSI for almost everything in gameplay that isn't shooting or slicing, such as running, jumping, blocking with melee, and maintenance. Research and medicine are present and very useful (you can even overdose people to death with your syringe!), but good luck finding all the random drops that you need for actual research. Hacking also exists and can be pretty useful, whether to disable turrets or open doors and posess/destroy something or someone, but you may or may not like the system used for it and you definitely need to apply a good amount of skill points to be any good at it.It has some of the most atmospheric and beautiful places and art style I've ever seen, but also many underused or even plain useless areas. It happens to be one of the most stable games I've played, with only only 1 crash during actual gameplay in my 20+ hours of game time, and yet trying to load certain maps after a few loads will frequently make your game crash, not to mention certain effect like Ultra Violence will make a successful load almost impossible, and the framerate is consistently awful in many places no matter what settings I use.There's a fascinating story to be found, with multiple paths and even a hidden ending that seems more along the lines of Deus Ex, but first time players might find it extremely confusing until they play through it a first time and start checking out all the logs and getting info from other living beings. You can switch from Light to Heavy classes and use a crazy variety of weapons and gadgets, but not only do you need to level up your stats for dozens of hours in certain cases, you also need the large amount of money to buy them... the hammer is especially insane.The game has a lot of replayability, as you can come back at any time into the maps and do side missions with random elements applied, special missions (custom maps) or jump online and play Coop or PvP with other players. Unfortunately, I wasn't able to test multiplayer myself since the community is incredibly small, even after the summer sale, which is a real shame.I'd like to end this review by saying that, unlike what many people are claiming, I actually found this game pretty easy to get into. Yes, the story and the many systems implemented are confusing at first, but starting out in the Campaign and slowly finishing it will make things much clearer for you. There are also many tutorial videos integrated into the game if you need them, and the openness of the map and objectives make you feel more at ease, since you can tackle things the way you want to. Get past those first steps and you'll understand exactly why I enjoy this game so much. It's totally worth it!

content:
Posted: June 22, 2014
												This game is a wonderfully weird cyberpunk action-RPG with weird yet interesting plot and clunky gameplay. Think of this game as original Deus Ex's ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ son, now going to meet his father and having couple of beers together. That's what this game is. It is not the best shooter nor the best RPG around, but the weirdness and innovative things (Like hacking being battling) and interesting mechanics, make the game seem a bit less clunky. Still, around the sales when you can get the game cheap. It becomes from "Try" to "Must-Buy" for all the RPG fans. You must try this madness and hopefully, enjoy it as well.

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 29, 2014
												An exceptional, standout action-shooter rpg, with a few quirks, brilliant art style, and a unique vision.The gameplay is punchy, colorful, and varied enough that I find myself continuing to come back.This game is heavy with customization which will create a bump in the road for some, but once you get over this initial (5 minute) hump of the menu system, you'll have yourself onto a rocking ride set in an intriguing universe.Combat seamlessly mixes GUNS, SWORDS, and PSYCHIC POWERS, while fusing with machinery.Its a lethal combination that can be crafted to your personal taste.Hacking, Machine control, rambo-style play, stealth, super-human abilities... its all here. Whatever you want.This game sets itself apart in art style, excellent combat, nonlinear branching story (with meaningful plot points the player can influence), and a setting/mood that REALLY takes you somewhere else.If you take time to pick up the snippets of story and explore a bit you'll enjoy it more.The ambient-orchestral soundtrack is peerless for games in this category.The customization is deep and allows you to truly craft any character style you can think of.The fact that this was an indie game made for less than $1m is stunning. The production values for a game of this type are rather high.While lacking in extensive voice overs, I found that the quirky dialogue and text based story actually added literary charm from the game and did not detract from the main idea.Excellent gunplay, co-op, deathmatch, cool characters, and meaningful branching story choices will create a sense of intrigue, deep moods, and powerful action.The only thing that would stop you from enjoying this is You are tossed into the game and expected to figure it out. Please take the time (5 minutes tops) to do so. You won't regret it.For ten bucks (I got it for $5 steam sale), its a steal. It's been almost 3 years since this game came out and I'm still playing it.Somehow it just hits on all of the right notes.Play it. And if you do, message me for a multiplayer game.Good job. I hope to see more updates from this studio.

content:
Posted: July 2, 2016
												At first I didn't want to buy this game because it looked like a game focused on multi-player (Counter Strike, Neotokyo), but then I found out that it actually has single-player story and some rpg elements, so I bought it on sale and decided to give it a try.The game has a lot of potential, but the mix of genres they were trying to go for just doesn't feel right. It kind of feels like deus ex occasionaly, but the feeling is so subtle you can hardly notice. Everything in this game is a mess, you can't talk about something in it without also mentioning some poor design decisions. It has good level design, and yet it hasn'tIt has good rpg elements, and yet it hasn'tIt has a good story, and yet it hasn'tIt has a good idea behind it, and yet it feels emptyDo you see where I'm going?I feel like if the devs had more experience and a clear goal of what they want to make it'd be a great game comparable to Deus Ex and System Shock. Yet you can draw inspiration from this game, you really can. This mess of ideas makes this game unique in it's own way. I'd recommend buying this game just because of that, just because it tried to do something new and different

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 17, 2014
												This is a completely insane, awesome, awe inspiring and beautiful well thought out game. The mechanics are indepth but not buggy. The weapons are fun and a little OP on lower difficulties, but easily able to change the difficulty setting. The artwork is gorgeous absolutely stunning. I can not recommend ths game more highly. It has a nice mix of RPG/FPS that isn't to far inclinded either way. There is almost a steam punky element to it, it is definetly a co-op game. I've had no problems at all so far, the only real negative i have for it. Is that sometimes it's a bit hard to see during the day, and the load times for joining a LAN is a little bit annoying. If you enjoyed Deus ex/ watch dogs you'll definetely enjoy this. It was a bargain at $1 but for me personally it was a $1 well spent. The story line is very indepth and can take quite a bit to adjust to but, you can skip a lot of it if you just want to skip straight to the action. You can go all guns blazing but you may die a lot it does cause you to think about how you select your load out for each mission. And that is the great thing your not stuck with one class you can use all weapons and change if you come across an amoury in the larger maps, they are scattered and easy enough to backtrack and find. There is a steep learning curve but if you keep at it, you certainly get many hours out of it.

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 15, 2014
												One of a select few games where the world and lore genuinely interests me. The world combines elements from things like Warhammer 40K, Deus Ex, The Matrix and is... absolutely weird, in the best possible way. The game has a stylish cyberpunk/ religious theme with some stunning level design (levels are huge too), particularly early on. The game is a pretty good shooter, guns feel good and the enormous range of unlocks, stats, researches etc. leaves plenty to be discovered. One of my favourite features is the completely customisable difficulty which includes factors such as enemy hearing radius, sight radius and respawn time. There are a few downsides, the game is pretty obtuse (although some, me included, might like that. There is no hand holding). Also, the game is pretty buggy and I suffer from frequent crashes and derps.TLDR: The game has problems, but if you like the orignal Deus Ex and enjoy themes from things such as Warhammer 40k, then this game HAS to be experienced.EDIT: One feature I forgot to mention is the element of persistence and the way your profile levels. It's pretty cool. You can also do secondary missions, which act like challenge maps, if you just want to shoot some enemies, or test new abilities. So far I have spent more time in the secondary missions than in the story missions.

content:
Posted: April 23, 2013
												One of the greatest and coolest (and not well known)games of our time just got a major update today, introducing new maps, new PVP game mods and improving the last flaws it had. Because truth is it was really weird and really bugged upon launch - no wonder, it was done by a team of 8 people only. But now, it's a jewel, with great universe, lot of stuff to explore, and mindblowing story. Add a flexible RPG system, PSI powers, teleportation, telekinezy, loads of weapons, research of new items and skillz, various side quests, non-linearity of missions, hacking of EVERYTHING, possesing minds of enemy turrets, droids and even cyber-enhanced people with hundreds of ways how to finish your objective, and, simply put......coop for up to 8 people...... THERE IS THE GREATEST CYBER-PUNK COOP/PVP FPS RPG EVER MADE. Must have for fans of cyberpunk and must have for fans of coop fps gaming.

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 5, 2014
												A strange title indeed. You will love it and you will hate it, something only EYE can do. Its cyberpunk setting bleeds with style that deus ex wishes it could be. A nicer UI and translation is something to be desired but the true beutiy in EYE is how you can build your character anyway you want. You want to be a sneaky ninja, sprinting though front lines and slicing off limbs or stick to the shadows you can. You want to be a hacker and break in to ATMs and other's brains and make them attack on another. You can do that too.It is a game that will keep you comming back looking for new ways to handle situations and try out diffrenerent play styles untill you have built a character that is almost godlike with all your cyberimplants and spells.It is a unique title that treads where others are to afraid to go, and there is co-op so you and some firends can run around this distopian cyber wonderland together.

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 31, 2015
												Highly underrated.A surprisingly unique and in-depth game, especially for a budget title.The campaign is not that long, but with the game's multiple endings, there's a lot of replayability, especially since there's a lot to keep building up your character with. The secondary and special missions are not at all required, but some of them are very rewarding.The game is flawed in a lot of ways (bugs, hilariously bad translations,...) but the unique experience makes up for it.Note that E.Y.E. doesn't explain too much about the game. The tutorials are not that useful. However, gradually figuring the game out while playing is a lot of fun. The lore and the main story are vague and sometimes cryptic but totally worth getting into.  Do not expect much of the server browser, but playing with friends can be a lot of fun. Do I recommend this game? Hell yes.Also dirt cheap during sales, so no reason to NOT buy it then.

content:
Posted: December 1, 2013
												.....this is a difficult one. This game has some serious issues, it has flawed mechanics, unplayable classes, unbalanced weapons as well as a very strange story. But there is something about it that I love.It has deep music, a very interesting plot. Scary elements as well as mind-screw abound. It also has the darkest techno-future atmosphere that I have ever seen. But it's a pig. Really, it's hard to love and easy to hate. It is a game where you can go invisible and strike enemies with samurai swords. A game where you will have great difficulty completing on your first run and will be left wondering at the end what to make of it all. I won't lie it isn't a game for most people, it's very offbeat, very unclassifiable. But underneath all the poor gameplay and bad story-telling, there is something about it I like. It has atmosphere. It's sombre, dark and sometimes scary. Darkened corridors where beasts could come at you from nowhere if you don't pay attention. Red alert lights flash while you thud your cyberboots around, looking for an access panel to hack to stop the damn defense turrets from targetting you. All while on an alien and completely inhoispitable planet somewhere in a distant future which is calous, cruel or downright ignorant to your plight. Or closer to home where cyber-punks fight the megacorp soldiers. Chinese writing sprawled in holographic advertisements accross walls. Tenement blocks under siege from monstrous creatures. The spawn of an alien force known as the metastreum. They are relentless, and they never stop coming. But you have a mission to complete, you can let the soldiers and beasts fight amongst themselves. It's the future and it's dark, just like it should be. That is the atmosphere of the game. But ultimately, it suffers from too many set-backs to make it a good game, or even an average game. Really, it's worth no more than £3. And even then, only if you are a certain kind of person. Check it out on youtube to see what I mean.

content:
Posted: November 28, 2016
												Have you ever wondered what's it like to be insane? Well, then this is the game for you. E.Y.E is an RPG that does a great job of fooling you into thinking it's an FPS action game. Kill scores of enemies, make made brozouf, get used to constantly repairing your broken cyber legs and learn what it feels like to get hacked by an ATM. Use your experience points to become the ultimate magical space warrior, spend your brozoufs to replace your cheap space chinese manufactured legs with slightly better ones. Weapons, drones, invisibility cloaks, space magic - all are for sale as long as you got the brozoufs to pay the greedy space merchants. Oh and don't trust anyone, they're all ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s, including you - the main character. Fight, struggle and do ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ all in an atempt to escape the cycles of your guilt and figure out what it all means, then do it all over again.

content:
Posted: January 10, 2014
												Story:The story itself is not so bad, but badly written/translated dialogues are a big drawback. By the way, english is not my native language, but even I spotted some errors.Design:The design its not so bad, it is a real cyberpunk game with some fantasy elements. The style of the game is not bad, but its unpolished and cheap (I will talk more about it in graphics section). The game system is not bad, but there are things like "permanent wounds", too many respawns (there is no game over), endless enemy spawns and researches, that were really bad ideas. The interface is not intuitive at all, if you never played games like Deus Ex before, you are going to have a hard time to figure out what to do and you will need a lot of patience, to watch many ingame video tutorials.Graphics:We can not really talk about graphics in this game. It is a source engine game, but when you play Half-Life 2 nowadays, you can still say, it has good graphics, but you can not say this about this game. Same ugly textures are used repetitively. There is lack of variety in character models. By the way, you can not find any characters with full face, everyone have at least half of his/her face covered. The level design is terrible and lazy, very lazy. There are many empty spaces and many impasses with no point. The best map is "New Eden" and even there you can feel the cheapness.Audio:I really like the music, it sets the dark mood of the game. There is no voice acting at all, you need to read all dialogues.Gameplay:Shooting with guns is fun, but some powers that you can unlock later are very unique and really fun to use. Missions can be done aggressively or in stealth, but do not expect any chances for pacifism (this is something I like in this game).Conclusion:Well, after so much negative said, you maybe think that there is no reason to play this game, but if you have some good friend/friends with which you can play this game, then it is enjoyable. Even if you play alone, you can have fun for several hours. But to be honest even with friends, this game can be really boring after few hours of gameplay.

Posted: January 29, 2014
												     Well, here we are, EYE Divine Cybermancy. This game is confusing. This game is hilarious. There's a lot you can say about this game, and honestly, it's hard to find what to say. And that's a good thing, because if there's so much you want to tell to someone who might play the game that you can't fit it all in a review, then it's definitely a good game. To describe why this game is so good, allow me to abridge my 100+ hours of experience in it into a short story.     As I began the game, I had no idea what I was doing. The story was so convoluted I laughed it off, I had no idea how to regenerate hp, and the menus were almost unitelligible. The entire effect was compounded by the french to english translation, which while not poor, has some funny errors. Nevertheless, I picked up a katana that zaps people so hard they explode and went huntin'.      After playing through the campaign once, hitting level 15 or so, and still feeling completely brainf$&%d, I tried out the multiplayer, joining up with my friend soon gaining a taste for blood in laggy katana combat and hilarious multi kill OHK man portable nuclear launcher shootouts. Sure, the multiplayer wasn't balanced, but that doesn't matter when you're having so much dang fun. Playing even more campaign and missions, I soon began to wonder about the gameworld itself to some extent, learning the names of creatures and weapons. And, while at first blush EYE appeared to be nothing more than a meaningless gibfest of dirty space rasta pirates and future holy space warriors with BIG ZAPPY KATANAS, I suddenly comprehended the extent of this game's universe.     Fast forward to where I am now, #1 ranked active Battle Royale player and almost level 10 in all cyber part stats, and I still don't know everything about this game (and that's not stemming from the fact that I haven't played enough campaign!) Everything in this game has an intrinsic meaning to the complex and psychological storyline, and it seems the more that I figure out about the games protagonist, the more I want to know (and fervently hope for a sequel.) This game is chock full of anything you could want from a videogame. It's got all the explosive gibs and schlock you might want from something senseless and violent, but at the same time it has a storyline with a depth that rivals some of the most thought provoking games of this generation. For 10 dollas, you can't go wrong.

number of helpful: 3 of 5 people (60%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 10, 2014
												Story:The story itself is not so bad, but badly written/translated dialogues are a big drawback. By the way, english is not my native language, but even I spotted some errors.Design:The design its not so bad, it is a real cyberpunk game with some fantasy elements. The style of the game is not bad, but its unpolished and cheap (I will talk more about it in graphics section). The game system is not bad, but there are things like "permanent wounds", too many respawns (there is no game over), endless enemy spawns and researches, that were really bad ideas. The interface is not intuitive at all, if you never played games like Deus Ex before, you are going to have a hard time to figure out what to do and you will need a lot of patience, to watch many ingame video tutorials.Graphics:We can not really talk about graphics in this game. It is a source engine game, but when you play Half-Life 2 nowadays, you can still say, it has good graphics, but you can not say this about this game. Same ugly textures are used repetitively. There is lack of variety in character models. By the way, you can not find any characters with full face, everyone have at least half of his/her face covered. The level design is terrible and lazy, very lazy. There are many empty spaces and many impasses with no point. The best map is "New Eden" and even there you can feel the cheapness.Audio:I really like the music, it sets the dark mood of the game. There is no voice acting at all, you need to read all dialogues.Gameplay:Shooting with guns is fun, but some powers that you can unlock later are very unique and really fun to use. Missions can be done aggressively or in stealth, but do not expect any chances for pacifism (this is something I like in this game).Conclusion:Well, after so much negative said, you maybe think that there is no reason to play this game, but if you have some good friend/friends with which you can play this game, then it is enjoyable. Even if you play alone, you can have fun for several hours. But to be honest even with friends, this game can be really boring after few hours of gameplay.

content:
Posted: September 5, 2015
												This game goes on sale often, and can be bought for a dollar. Would I buy it for $10? Eh. maybe. The game is entertaining, and even though it says co op, you may end up having a lot of issues with co op.  Me and my friend did, and there are guides all over the web on how to fix it. But with those kind of guides I'm always the kind to mess them up. But, those guides are not by the devs, and they never did anything to fix the issues. So, dont expect to play co op. It ran alright with Hamachi (thats how you spell it right?) but I noticed I was lagging considerably while playing with Hamachi. I dont know if it was my friends connection or mine, although I was the host of the server. His connection wasnt the best at the time, but we havent tried recently. Everything else though, is entertaining, and I think worth the play alone. Although, Im the kind to be playing Borderlands alone. Overall I recommend it, but if you're looking for a fun co op game, I do not recommend.

number of helpful: 3 of 5 people (60%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 1, 2013
												An interesting game with bad execution due to a low budget and inexperienced developers.The game feels like a Source mod. (partially because it IS running on the Source engine)The story itself is interesting, but at times I felt that the character dialogue was written by an amateur or a fan fic writer.The UI is rather clunky at times and looks bad in some places due to bad usage of text color, text font and overall spacing. Not to mention, the game has received multiple updates and yet a certain bug (UI text not updating often) is not yet fixed.Some weapon/power sounds feel unsatisfying and the voice acting is weak.The use of stock Source engine sounds break immersion as well.The mapping is horrible in certain areas, not to mention that some of the maps perform badly on a considerably high-end PC. (some might say that this is because the engine is outdated or that designing a large scale map in the Source engine is hard, but I beg to differ, as I've seen outstanding maps done in Source mods or by single mappers.)The weapons are rather out of balance - at the start of the game, you have access to 2 weapons in most categories, and most categories have 1 COMPLETELY superior weapon to the other. Why bother adding 2 weapons if there are no trade-offs at all and you start out with 2 weapons in each category with one of them being completely superior to the other?Not to mention the SMGs are COMPLETELY inferior to every other weapon in every single way.The graphics are bad as well. The textures on some objects are low resolution, the bump maps on some weapons are bad and some world textures are not that pleasing for the eye either.What I did like is the depth based depth of field shader (which I haven't seen in any Valve games) and the holographic sights, but even then, it's something you see in most modern games.The game's difficulty is strange. The starting mission is easy as pie, yet the moment you get to play the first mission, you get your♥♥♥♥♥♥wrecked if you're not experienced at FPS games. (luckily that's not the case for me)This game will NOT hold your hand. It's very brutal and unforgiving. If you're a CoD kiddie, don't expect to like this game.The RPG elements, on the other hand, are nicely thought through and there are a lot of things to level up and unlock, which is very good.The gun play is robust and satisfying, although it's really ♥♥♥♥ing annoying to die because of the good ol' Source engine's physics ♥♥♥♥ing up by blocking your movement because you bumped into a prop and got stuck in it while you're getting shot at.All in all, I'd give this game a 4.5/10. I'd say that this game is a flawed gem, and if it had a bigger budget and more developers, it'd be an amazing game.Lastly, I have to admit that despite it's flaws I fell in love with this game.

												Brought this "Diamond in the rough" on sale for 1 buck, certaily lived up to it's name, alright. content:
Posted: May 18, 2012
												This game has a lot of technical problems. And by "a lot" I mean "it took me several installs and tweaks to get it working." Once I got past that, though, I found a cool cyberpunk-inspired (albeit relatively empty) world of intrigue with an interesting visual style in front of me. In some ways, it's like Deus Ex, but its primary focus is combat rather than role-playing, and this is where it succeeds beautifully. The shooting mechanics feel just right and even the melee isn't a broken mess. Another interesting feature is the hacking minigame, which is surprisingly challenging and requires quick action and thought to succeed. If you can get past the absolutely absurd storyline, technical issues, and somewhat empty world, it's pretty solid.

												why do i always get tricked by developers who go for the cyberpunk style? i'm such a huge sucker for cyberpunk games.this is one of those tales that never really got translated from french properly, and probably wasn't that good anyway. i think it's an emotion piece, but i don't give a♥♥♥♥♥♥about any of the dudes in power armor. the only way you can tell plot characters apart is by how fancy or stupid looking their armor is.oh, and i know that if you really shot another testosterone fuelled 'roid raging power armor friend, they would probably be quite mad, but i doubt they'd instantly turn around and fill you with bullets from their minigun.what's really irritating, is i mistakenly killed the traitor before he revealed he was a traitor on a subsequent playthrough, and failed. BUT I KNOW I HAVE TO KILL HIM TO FINISH THE LEVELit's a quirky game, with some strong points, character and generally feels like a cohesive, yet poorly lit, experience. i wouldn't recommend it though. unless you're obsessed with power armor and mysterious plots that seem to have no engaging aspects, you probably will find this dull and uninspired.

content:
Posted: July 21, 2015
												If you ever played Dark Souls and think it's the hardest game in the world, this game will prove you wrong, and then it'll anally penetrate you with a cactus, continuously pounding you with it afterwards. That's just side missions on Normal difficulty. This game truly knows how to tell you "♥♥♥♥ YOU" the most harsh way possible.But oh wait, it has a higher difficulty? Not just that, on it's highest difficulty you'll die before you even see that cloaked ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ on the other side of the map.Other than that, it's a highly enjoyable game if you really get into it and ignore all of the faulty parts, like players twitching like druggies in co-op mode from time to time... or weapons making zero sense at some points... or your hands completely mismatching your suit... But hey, it's a Source game from 2011 and it's low budget, so chill out.No wonders it has an asian mode difficulty level though, because everything in the game is asian as ♥♥♥♥. The first character you'll meet, who actually has voice acting, will start talking gibberish. Good thing there's a massive translation text in the center when they talk though. Every single thing like an ancient scroll or hologram on a computer will also be asian or in a binary code which can't even be translated.Hacking in the game is pretty simple, but it can be annoying as hell at times.You have 5 options in hacking : "Attack", which deals damage to your opponent's virus, "Mask", which reduces your opponent's virus' damage, "Scan", which weakens their virus' shield, "Shield", which hardens your virus' shield, "Overflow", which trades some of your shield for some damage points.Each action in hacking takes time, and you can only pick one at once, so choose wisely.Also you can't protect yourself while hacking, so good luck trying to hack a bank dispenser while being molested by 10 semi-invincible guys with miniguns or a massive robot-demon-imp-cyborg-thing that has a cannon machinegun, which will probably instakill you.Gladly, stealth is an option in this game, which is great... for those who want to focus on that. However, you can also be a heavily armored terminator or a crazy monkey with a gun if you want, it's all up to you.Useful tips for this game :-Never ♥♥♥♥ around in the HQ/sanctuary when you're near friendly NPCs(and don't kill Jians, despite them being complete ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s to you). Even jumping onto someone's head off a certain height will make everyone mow you down.-Play on "Normal" or "Easy" diffculty if you don't want to get♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥-Don't experiment with weapons on high difficulty, just go straight for the most ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ and overpowered gun ever.-Be ready for sp00ks-Don't let anything hack you unless it's for the achievement, especially in combat zones.-Don't be too trigger happy, some NPCs are friendly in campaign mode. Even a creepy♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ing monster that's hidden in a wall.-Don't challenge heavily armored minigun guys with your sword.Oh, and remember I said this game is asian af? Yeah, also every character has blank white eyes and your mentor is an animated armored statue with a golden head. Awesome, right?

content:
Posted: February 15
"The same dream again... I'm here... but...I don't know or remember where 'here' is."You awake in a hazy ruin, feeling nauseousand your vision blurry. You find yourself cladin light armor plating with a small pistol and katana in your possession. You walk to the light source of the ruin; the portal, the one that brought you here... you think.E.Y.E. - DIVINE CYBERMANCYYou see the corpse of someone in moreornate armor and check the surroundings,seeing thousands of gigantic blades andkatanas embedded everywhere. You findyourself monologuing about having killedthat man on the ground, your mentor, butyou don't know why.You enter the portal and are transportedback to reality of E.Y.E. A dystopian futurewasteland inspired by Blade Runner, yousee the trappings of a familiar reality madeby Source. You report to your commander,a powerfully built man named Rimanah whois suspicious of your Mentor who is namedthe Mentor.In this hellish world, you remember howfractured and disjointed the storytelling ofDark Souls was, and this game- this realityis none the wiser. Although steeped in fog,murky shadows and drab colors, the worldof E.Y.E. finds you wanting to explore more,making you lost within its complex worldand its engaging gameplay.Finding yourself in the role of an E.Y.E.agent of the Secreta Sectorum fightingagainst the larger dominion of the strangeand ever-present Federation, the forces ofthe Culter Dei and the Jiang Shang Di, theremnants of East and West in this blastedreality have come to work together toestablish order and fight back the spawnof the Meta-streunomic Forces which havebrought the world to ruin.On every death, the HUD shows your"resurectors" activating, even as youswear that the typo in the display isindeed deliberate. When you die andyour resurectors are spent, you findyourself standing at the portal with thethousand swords, but no Mentor, butwith a mysterious man greets you inJiang Shang Di armor, warning youcryptically that all this, all that is tocome is yet to be revealed.The first-person perspective and thelack of focus on graphics creates atense, brooding environment filled withpersonality. As you undertake missionscleaning out gangsters in nondescriptcities and uncovering that there is moreto both your Mentor and CommanderRimanah themselves, the world of E.Y.E.has not only immersed you fully within it,but has made you forget your purpose."Starboy Coldheart." You hear one someone call out to you asyou are about to leave on another mission for Commander Rimanah, with your rifleand the greatsword Damocles with you. The Mysterious man in your death looksat you from a distance. The HUD now presents him as "The Nightingale" andyou draw your sword."In my dreams... my death... I saw you,stranger. Who are you? What are you?"The Nightingale gestures slowly, but ina way that shows he is in perfect control."This is not your world, Coldheart. Andyou have been sidetracked here... yourmission lies elsewhere." Puzzled, andrealizing that this 'Nightingale' knowsmore than he is letting on, you pointthe Damocles at him accusingly, youreyes narrowing."...what DO you know of my mission?"You hiss at the Nightingale, defensiveand afraid of the truth that you haveforgotten since arriving in this world."That Summer-Rain is still out there...and that you seek a chance to bewith her again." The Nightingale nowwhirls his staff, and in a blink, the E.Y.E.fortress is no more and the ruin of thethousands swords and the portal greetsyou again. "Starboy Coldheart..." TheNightingale begins, readying his staffto fight you- "You must leave... youcannot finish E.Y.E."You pull back the Damocles to readyyourself against The Nightingale, yourresponse a shout. "NO! I AM AN AGENTOF THE CULTER DEI! I WILL FIND THETRUTH OF E.Y.E.!"You charge and meet with him, TheNightingale; in combat, his mysteriousstaff channelling the Meta-streunomicforces against the technological mightof the Damocles. The vicious duel lastsmere moments, before The Nightingaleuses the Meta-streunomic force tooverpower and send you hurtling intothe portal."I do this for your own good, StarboyColdheart... you are needed elsewhere.To finish E.Y.E. is folly." The Nightingalewarns again, walking to you as you holdon to the edges of the portal, your handand face the only parts of you still withinthe world of E.Y.E. "I can do this. I canstop the Meta-strunomic force before itdestroys everything!"The Nightingale readies his staff to hityour hand away to send you into onlywhat the Gods know. "No, StarboyColdheart. You have never understood.The Meta-streunomic force has neverdestroyed..." With a swing, you feel your hand let go as the staff hits and sends you into the portal fully, The lastwords of the Nightingale ringing in yourears. "...only changed. Farewell."E.Y.E. - DIVINE CYBERMANCY

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 27, 2016
												A very confusing yet fun cyberpunk shooter to play. Originally playing it back during release in 2011, it was a buggy mess full of broken translations and glitches that had further convoluted the game even worse than the present version. Over time, these issues were ironed out but the game still remains a very confusing yet enjoyable experience.This game is primary a FPS with character leveling, allowing your character to grow even stronger as you continue to play through the title. You start off as a rather weak soldier, but as both your character levels up and you gain more experience playing the game, you will end up as a cybernetic powerhouse able to take on entire groups of heavily armored enemies in both gratuitous flair and efficiency. Generally all the weapons here outside of a few are generally worth using, much like an RPG you'll unlock more weapons and equipment as you level up and earn more money.The story is both one of the greatest and worst things in this game. This game doesn't give you all the information outright and only gives small pieces every so often and the player is expected to piece all of this together over time. This can be a turnoff for some players used to more modern games that by the end of the playthrough, there is nothing new to learn or find out even in NG+. To the players that are patient enough to piece it all together, you do get a mostly intact yet shattered picture of the game, the factions and so on.The campaign of the game is one of the high points with this game for me. You can do the campaign both in singleplayer and in coop, and unlike what the game description says you can have up to 32 people in one campaign. It's a fairly short campaign in comparison to other games, but requires NG+++ in order to 100% the campaign. When you get a group of people together to play through the campaign, it's something magical that reminds me of playing a Serious Sam title in Co-Op mode. There are other multiplayer modes such as a CTF like mode with classes and a round based deathmatch mode for multiplayer, but the multiplayer for campaign is overall a more solid experience than these.In short, it's a fantastic yet confusing  FPS that is especially fun with friends. Typically it goes on sale anywhere from $1.00-$2.50 which is well worth it at this pricetag.

												There's not much that can out-cyberpunk a game in which you can hack the phantom memories of a dead person's brain and, should you fail, get counterhack-attacked by the ICE he had installed. Mind you, this wasn't in the story campaign, this was a randomly generated mission that popped up while I was messing around on one of the maps. The game makes no sense, is extremely user unfriendly, poorly translated, has a trial-and-error steep learning curve, most of the achievements are completely random and your legs are always broken. But I'll recommend it forever and always for the brouzouf.
